levels.title: What is Data Science & AI?
levels.description: Get a high-level overview of the fields and their impact.

levels.title: Introduction to Python
levels.description: Learn the basics of Python, the primary language for data science.

levels.title: Python Data Types and Variables
levels.description: Understand how to store numbers, text, and other data.

levels.title: Python Lists, Tuples, and Dictionaries
levels.description: Learn to work with collections of data.

levels.title: Python Conditionals and Loops
levels.description: Control the flow of your Python programs.

levels.title: Python Functions
levels.description: Write reusable blocks of code.

levels.title: Essential Math: Linear Algebra
levels.description: Understand vectors, matrices, and operations fundamental to AI.

levels.title: Essential Math: Calculus
levels.description: Grasp derivatives and gradients, the basis of model optimization.

levels.title: Essential Math: Probability and Statistics
levels.description: Learn about distributions, mean, median, and variance.

levels.title: Introduction to NumPy
levels.description: The fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.

levels.title: Creating and Manipulating NumPy Arrays
levels.description: Learn to work with powerful N-dimensional arrays.

levels.title: Introduction to Pandas
levels.description: A powerful library for data manipulation and analysis.

levels.title: Pandas DataFrames and Series
levels.description: Understand the core data structures of Pandas.

levels.title: Loading Data into Pandas (from CSV)
levels.description: Import your first dataset from a file.

levels.title: Data Cleaning: Handling Missing Values
levels.description: Learn basic techniques for dealing with incomplete data.

levels.title: Data Exploration with Pandas
levels.description: Use `.describe()` and `.info()` to understand your data.

levels.title: Introduction to Data Visualization
levels.description: Understand why visualizing data is crucial.

levels.title: Your First Plot with Matplotlib
levels.description: Create basic plots like line charts and scatter plots.

levels.title: Prettier Plots with Seaborn
levels.description: A high-level interface for drawing attractive statistical graphics.

levels.title: Understanding Machine Learning Concepts
levels.description: Learn about supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning.

levels.title: Training, Validation, and Test Sets
levels.description: Understand how to split data to evaluate model performance.

levels.title: Your First Model: Linear Regression
levels.description: Predict continuous values based on linear relationships.

levels.title: Introduction to Scikit-Learn
levels.description: The most popular library for traditional machine learning.

levels.title: Building a Model with Scikit-Learn
levels.description: Train your first Scikit-Learn model with the `.fit()` method.

levels.title: Model Evaluation: Metrics for Regression
levels.description: Understand Mean Squared Error (MSE) and R-squared.

levels.title: Your Second Model: Logistic Regression
levels.description: A fundamental algorithm for classification problems.

levels.title: Model Evaluation: Metrics for Classification
levels.description: Understand accuracy, precision, and recall.

levels.title: The Confusion Matrix
levels.description: A powerful tool for visualizing classification performance.

levels.title: Version Control with Git for Data Science
levels.description: Track changes in your code and notebooks.

levels.title: Jupyter Notebooks and Labs
levels.description: The standard interactive environment for data science.

levels.title: What is an API?
levels.description: Learn how programs communicate and share data.

levels.title: Fetching Data from an API
levels.description: Use Python's `requests` library to get data from the web.

levels.title: Introduction to SQL
levels.description: The standard language for querying relational databases.

levels.title: SQL SELECT and FROM clauses
levels.description: Write your first query to retrieve data.

levels.title: SQL WHERE clause
levels.description: Filter data based on specific conditions.

levels.title: Data Collection and Sourcing
levels.description: Understand different ways to acquire data for a project.

levels.title: Understanding Data Bias
levels.description: An introduction to the ethical implications of biased data.

levels.title: Feature Engineering: What is a Feature?
levels.description: Learn how to represent data for machine learning models.

levels.title: One-Hot Encoding
levels.description: A common technique for converting categorical data into a numerical format.

levels.title: Data Scaling and Normalization
levels.description: Understand why and how to scale your data features.

levels.title: Introduction to Overfitting and Underfitting
levels.description: A key challenge in machine learning.

levels.title: K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN)
levels.description: A simple and intuitive classification algorithm.

levels.title: Decision Trees
levels.description: A flowchart-like structure for making decisions.

levels.title: Introduction to Unsupervised Learning
levels.description: Find patterns in data without labeled outcomes.

levels.title: Clustering with K-Means
levels.description: Group similar data points together.

levels.title: The Data Science Lifecycle
levels.description: Understand the end-to-end process of a data science project.

levels.title: Communicating Data Insights
levels.description: Learn the importance of storytelling with data.

levels.title: Project: Analyze a Real-World Dataset
levels.description: Apply your Pandas and visualization skills to the Titanic dataset.

levels.title: Project: Predict Housing Prices
levels.description: Build a linear regression model on a housing dataset.

levels.title: Setting up a Data Science Environment
levels.description: Using Anaconda and virtual environments.

levels.title: Introduction to Big Data
levels.description: What is it and what are the challenges?

levels.title: History of AI
levels.description: From Turing tests to deep learning.

levels.title: AI Ethics: Fairness and Accountability
levels.description: An introduction to the ethical considerations in AI.

levels.title: Reading Scientific Papers
levels.description: Learn how to approach and understand research papers.

levels.title: Regular Expressions (Regex) for Text Processing
levels.description: A powerful tool for pattern matching in text.

levels.title: Web Scraping with BeautifulSoup
levels.description: Extract data from websites using Python.

levels.title: Introduction to Cloud Computing for AI
levels.description: What are AWS, GCP, and Azure?

levels.title: Introduction to Neural Networks
levels.description: The foundational concept of deep learning.

levels.title: Activation Functions
levels.description: The non-linear components of a neural network.

levels.title: Loss Functions
levels.description: How a neural network measures its own error.

levels.title: Gradient Descent
levels.description: The optimization algorithm used to train neural networks.

levels.title: Introduction to TensorFlow and Keras
levels.description: Popular deep learning frameworks.

levels.title: Introduction to PyTorch
levels.description: A flexible and widely-used deep learning framework.

levels.title: Building Your First Neural Network with Keras
levels.description: Create a simple neural network for a classification task.

levels.title: SQL JOINs
levels.description: Combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column.

levels.title: SQL Aggregations (GROUP BY, COUNT, SUM)
levels.description: Summarize and group data within your database.

levels.title: Data Warehousing Concepts
levels.description: Understand systems used for reporting and data analysis.

levels.title: ETL (Extract, Transform, Load)
levels.description: The process of moving data from source to data warehouse.

levels.title: The Role of a Data Analyst
levels.description: Focuses on interpreting data and communicating findings.

levels.title: The Role of a Data Engineer
levels.description: Focuses on building and maintaining data pipelines and infrastructure.

levels.title: The Role of a Machine Learning Engineer
levels.description: Focuses on deploying and maintaining ML models in production.

levels.title: Interactive Dashboards with Plotly/Dash
levels.description: Build interactive web applications for your data visualizations.

levels.title: Project: Customer Churn Prediction
levels.description: Build a classification model to predict if a customer will leave.

levels.title: Project: Image Classification with a Simple NN
levels.description: Classify handwritten digits from the MNIST dataset.

levels.title: Structured vs. Unstructured Data
levels.description: Understand the different types of data you'll encounter.

levels.title: Data Governance and Privacy
levels.description: Learn about the principles of managing data responsibly.

levels.title: Hyperparameter Tuning
levels.description: Optimize your model's performance by tuning its settings.

levels.title: Cross-Validation
levels.description: A robust technique for assessing model performance.

levels.title: Ensemble Methods: Random Forests
levels.description: Combine multiple decision trees to improve performance.

levels.title: Ensemble Methods: Gradient Boosting (XGBoost)
levels.description: A powerful and popular algorithm for tabular data.

levels.title: Support Vector Machines (SVM)
levels.description: A powerful classification algorithm based on finding the optimal hyperplane.

levels.title: Dimensionality Reduction: PCA
levels.description: Reduce the number of features in your dataset while preserving information.

levels.title: Deep Learning: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
levels.description: The standard architecture for computer vision tasks.

levels.title: Building an Image Classifier with CNNs
levels.description: Apply a CNN to a real-world image dataset like CIFAR-10.

levels.title: Transfer Learning for Image Recognition
levels.description: Leverage pre-trained models to achieve high performance quickly.

levels.title: Deep Learning: Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs)
levels.description: Networks designed to work with sequential data like text or time series.

levels.title: LSTMs and GRUs
levels.description: Advanced RNN architectures that solve the vanishing gradient problem.

levels.title: Natural Language Processing (NLP): Bag of Words
levels.description: A simple way to represent text data for machine learning models.

levels.title: NLP: TF-IDF
levels.description: A more advanced text representation that weights words by importance.

levels.title: NLP: Word Embeddings (Word2Vec, GloVe)
levels.description: Represent words as dense vectors in a continuous space.

levels.title: Building a Text Classifier with RNNs
levels.description: Perform sentiment analysis on movie reviews.

levels.title: Attention Mechanism
levels.description: The key innovation that led to the development of Transformers.

levels.title: Transformers and BERT
levels.description: The state-of-the-art architecture for most NLP tasks.

levels.title: Introduction to Large Language Models (LLMs)
levels.description: Understand what GPT-3 and other large models are.

levels.title: Prompt Engineering
levels.description: The art and science of crafting effective prompts for LLMs.

levels.title: Fine-tuning an LLM
levels.description: Adapt a pre-trained LLM for a specific task.

levels.title: Unsupervised Learning: Anomaly Detection
levels.description: Find unusual data points that don't fit the expected pattern.

levels.title: Unsupervised Learning: Association Rules
levels.description: Discover relationships between variables in large datasets (Market Basket Analysis).

levels.title: Time Series Analysis and Forecasting
levels.description: Analyze and predict data points collected over time.

levels.title: ARIMA Models
levels.description: A classical statistical model for time series forecasting.

levels.title: Reinforcement Learning Concepts
levels.description: Learn about agents, environments, rewards, and policies.

levels.title: Q-Learning
levels.description: A fundamental algorithm in reinforcement learning.

levels.title: Introduction to MLOps
levels.description: The practice of deploying and maintaining ML models in production reliably.

levels.title: Model Versioning and Registries
levels.description: Track experiments and manage model lifecycles.

levels.title: Serving Models with an API (FastAPI)
levels.description: Create a fast and efficient API to serve your model's predictions.

levels.title: Containerizing ML Models with Docker
levels.description: Package your model and its dependencies for easy deployment.

levels.title: Cloud AI Platforms (Vertex AI, SageMaker)
levels.description: Managed services for training and deploying ML models.

levels.title: A/B Testing and Experimentation
levels.description: Rigorously test the impact of your models in a live environment.

levels.title: Advanced SQL: Window Functions
levels.description: Perform calculations across a set of table rows.

levels.title: Advanced SQL: Common Table Expressions (CTEs)
levels.description: Write more readable and modular complex queries.

levels.title: Data Engineering: Apache Spark
levels.description: A powerful engine for large-scale data processing.

levels.title: Data Engineering: Airflow
levels.description: A platform to programmatically author, schedule, and monitor workflows.

levels.title: Causal Inference
levels.description: Move beyond correlation to understand cause-and-effect relationships.

levels.title: Bayesian Statistics
levels.description: A different approach to statistical inference.

levels.title: Building Recommender Systems: Collaborative Filtering
levels.description: Recommend items based on user behavior.

levels.title: Building Recommender Systems: Content-Based Filtering
levels.description: Recommend items based on their attributes.

levels.title: Explainable AI (XAI)
levels.description: Understand and interpret the predictions of complex models (SHAP, LIME).

levels.title: AI Ethics: Algorithmic Bias and Mitigation
levels.description: Techniques for identifying and reducing bias in models.

levels.title: Federated Learning
levels.description: Train ML models on decentralized data without data leaving the device.

levels.title: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)
levels.description: A class of models used for generative tasks like creating images.

levels.title: Autoencoders
levels.description: A type of neural network used for unsupervised learning and feature learning.

levels.title: Computer Vision: Object Detection (YOLO, R-CNN)
levels.description: Identify and locate objects within an image.

levels.title: Computer Vision: Image Segmentation
levels.description: Classify each pixel in an image.

levels.title: ML System Design Interviews
levels.description: Learn how to approach open-ended ML system design questions.

levels.title: Optimizing Python Code with Cython
levels.description: Write C-extensions for Python to speed up critical code.

levels.title: GPU Computing with CUDA
levels.description: A parallel computing platform and programming model from NVIDIA.

levels.title: Project: Build a Movie Recommender System
levels.description: Apply collaborative filtering techniques to a movie rating dataset.

levels.title: Project: Fine-tune a BERT model for Sentiment Analysis
levels.description: Achieve state-of-the-art performance on an NLP task.

levels.title: Project: Deploy a Scikit-Learn Model with FastAPI and Docker
levels.description: Create a production-ready model serving API.

levels.title: Project: Generate Art with a StyleGAN
levels.description: Explore the creative side of AI by training a generative model.

levels.title: Project: Time Series Forecasting for Stock Prices
levels.description: Apply time series models to financial data.

levels.title: Advanced Data Visualization with D3.js
levels.description: Create custom, interactive visualizations for the web.

levels.title: Geospatial Data Analysis
levels.description: Work with location-based data using libraries like GeoPandas.

levels.title: Network Analysis and Graph Theory
levels.description: Analyze relationships and networks using libraries like NetworkX.

levels.title: Building a Data Portfolio
levels.description: Showcase your skills and projects to potential employers.

levels.title: Kaggle Competitions
levels.description: Learn how to participate and compete in data science competitions.

levels.title: The Mathematics of Deep Learning
levels.description: A deeper dive into the mathematical foundations.

levels.title: Probabilistic Graphical Models
levels.description: A rich framework for encoding probability distributions over complex domains.

levels.title: Model Monitoring in Production
levels.description: Track model performance and detect concept drift over time.

levels.title: Data Privacy and Differential Privacy
levels.description: Formal techniques for ensuring the privacy of individuals in datasets.

levels.title: The Transformer Architecture In-Depth
levels.description: A deep dive into self-attention, positional encodings, and more.

levels.title: Efficient Transformers (Longformer, Reformer)
levels.description: Models designed to handle very long sequences.

levels.title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
levels.description: Enhance LLM responses by retrieving relevant external information.

levels.title: Deep Reinforcement Learning (DQN, A3C)
levels.description: Combine deep learning with reinforcement learning to solve complex problems.

levels.title: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs)
levels.description: Apply deep learning to graph-structured data.

levels.title: Self-Supervised Learning
levels.description: A form of unsupervised learning where the data provides the supervision.

levels.title: Meta-Learning (Learning to Learn)
levels.description: Train models that can quickly adapt to new tasks.

levels.title: Generative Models: VAEs and Flow-based Models
levels.description: Explore different architectures for generative modeling.

levels.title: Diffusion Models for Image Generation
levels.description: The state-of-the-art in high-quality image synthesis.

levels.title: Multimodal Learning
levels.description: Train models that can understand and process multiple data types (e.g., text and images).

levels.title: 3D Computer Vision
levels.description: Work with point clouds, meshes, and 3D scenes.

levels.title: AI for Robotics
levels.description: Apply AI and ML techniques to control and train robots.

levels.title: AI in Drug Discovery and Genomics
levels.description: Explore the application of AI in the life sciences.

levels.title: AI for Climate Change
levels.description: Using AI to model and mitigate the effects of climate change.

levels.title: Distributed Model Training
levels.description: Train massive models across multiple GPUs and machines.

levels.title: Model Quantization and Pruning
levels.description: Techniques for making large models smaller and faster for deployment.

levels.title: Deploying Models to the Edge
levels.description: Run AI models on low-power devices like mobile phones.

levels.title: Automated Machine Learning (AutoML)
levels.description: Automate the process of applying machine learning to real-world problems.

levels.title: Quantum Machine Learning
levels.description: An emerging field that explores the intersection of quantum computing and AI.

levels.title: Neuro-Symbolic AI
levels.description: Combining neural networks with symbolic reasoning for more robust AI.

levels.title: Building an End-to-End ML Platform
levels.description: Design the infrastructure for a data science team.

levels.title: Leading AI/Data Science Teams
levels.description: The skills required to manage and lead technical teams.

levels.title: AI Research: From Idea to Publication
levels.description: The process of conducting novel research and publishing a paper.

levels.title: Advanced Time Series: Prophet and Neural Prophet
levels.description: Explore Facebook's advanced forecasting libraries.

levels.title: Deep Time Series Forecasting (N-BEATS, Temporal Fusion Transformers)
levels.description: State-of-the-art deep learning models for forecasting.

levels.title: Topological Data Analysis
levels.description: Analyze the 'shape' of data using tools from topology.

levels.title: Advanced Recommender Systems: Factorization Machines
levels.description: A powerful model class for recommendation.

levels.title: Deep Learning for Recommender Systems
levels.description: Using neural networks to model complex user-item interactions.

levels.title: Model-Based Reinforcement Learning
levels.description: Learn a model of the environment to make planning more efficient.

levels.title: Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
levels.description: Scenarios with multiple interacting agents.

levels.title: NLP: Language Model Architectures (GPT vs T5 vs Llama)
levels.description: A deep dive into the architectural differences of major LLMs.

levels.title: Vision Transformers (ViT)
levels.description: Applying the transformer architecture to computer vision.

levels.title: AI Agents and Autonomous Systems
levels.description: Designing systems that can perceive, reason, and act.

levels.title: LLM Alignment and Safety
levels.description: Research into making powerful AI systems safe and beneficial.

levels.title: Mechanistic Interpretability
levels.description: Trying to understand how a neural network computes its function, circuit by circuit.

levels.title: Real-time Bidding and Ad-Tech AI
levels.description: The high-frequency, low-latency AI used in online advertising.

levels.title: AI for Scientific Discovery
levels.description: Using AI to accelerate discovery in fields like physics and materials science.

levels.title: The Business of AI
levels.description: Product management, strategy, and monetization for AI products.

levels.title: Capstone Project: Novel Research
levels.description: Design and execute a research project with the goal of a workshop publication.

levels.title: Capstone Project: Build a Production ML System
levels.description: Design, build, and deploy an end-to-end ML system for a real problem.

levels.title: Capstone Project: Open Source Contribution
levels.description: Make a significant contribution to a major ML library like PyTorch or Hugging Face.

levels.title: Capstone Project: Found an AI Startup
levels.description: Develop an MVP and a business plan for a new AI-powered company.

levels.title: AI and the Future of Work
levels.description: Analyze the societal and economic impact of AI.

levels.title: Advanced NLP: Question Answering Systems
levels.description: Design systems that can answer questions posed in natural language.

levels.title: Advanced NLP: Text Summarization
levels.description: Build models that can summarize long documents.

levels.title: Advanced NLP: Machine Translation
levels.description: The technology behind services like Google Translate.

levels.title: Video Understanding
levels.description: Apply computer vision and sequence modeling to understand video content.

levels.title: Speech Recognition (ASR)
levels.description: The technology that converts spoken language into text.

levels.title: Text-to-Speech (TTS)
levels.description: The technology that synthesizes human-like speech from text.

levels.title: Causal Representation Learning
levels.description: Learning variables that correspond to the underlying causal mechanisms of the world.

levels.title: AI Governance and Policy
levels.description: The challenges of regulating and governing powerful AI systems.

levels.title: Thinking about AGI
levels.description: Exploring the path and challenges towards Artificial General Intelligence.

levels.title: Distributed Data Processing with Dask
levels.description: A flexible parallel computing library for analytics.

levels.title: Real-time Feature Stores (e.g., Feast)
levels.description: Infrastructure for managing and serving ML features in production.

levels.title: Vector Databases (e.g., Pinecone, Weaviate)
levels.description: Databases designed for efficient similarity search on high-dimensional vectors.

levels.title: The JAX Ecosystem
levels.description: A high-performance numerical computing library from Google.

levels.title: Deep Learning on Graphs
levels.description: Advanced techniques for applying neural networks to graph data.

levels.title: Uncertainty Quantification in Deep Learning
levels.description: Making models that know what they don't know.

levels.title: Few-Shot Learning
levels.description: Training models to learn from very few examples.

levels.title: Zero-Shot Learning
levels.description: Training models to perform tasks they have never seen before.

levels.title: Continual Learning
levels.description: Training models that can learn sequentially without forgetting past knowledge.

levels.title: AI-Powered Code Generation (e.g., AlphaCode)
levels.description: Systems that can write competitive-level programming code.

levels.title: Advanced Kubernetes for ML (Kubeflow)
levels.description: The Machine Learning Toolkit for Kubernetes.

levels.title: The Data-Centric AI Movement
levels.description: An approach that focuses on systematically engineering data for ML models.

levels.title: Foundation Models
levels.description: Understand the concept and implications of models trained on broad data at scale.

levels.title: Human-in-the-Loop Machine Learning
levels.description: Combining human and machine intelligence to create better models.

levels.title: The AI Research Landscape
levels.description: Understanding the key conferences (NeurIPS, ICML) and labs (DeepMind, OpenAI).

levels.title: AI Product Management
levels.description: The unique challenges of managing and shipping AI-powered products.

levels.title: AI and Law
levels.description: Exploring the legal challenges and frameworks related to AI.

levels.title: Simulation and Digital Twins
levels.description: Using AI to create and learn from virtual environments.

levels.title: AI for Creativity and Art
levels.description: Exploring the use of AI as a tool for artistic expression.

levels.title: The Future of AI Hardware (TPUs, Neuromorphic Chips)
levels.description: How specialized hardware is shaping the future of AI.

levels.title: Building a Personal AI Lab
levels.description: Setting up your own hardware and software for serious AI experimentation.

levels.title: Presenting at a Technical Conference
levels.description: The skills needed to share your research with the community.

levels.title: Grant Writing for AI Research
levels.description: Learn how to secure funding for your research ideas.

levels.title: The Philosophy of Artificial Intelligence
levels.description: Exploring questions of consciousness, intelligence, and ethics.

levels.title: The AI Grandmaster Challenge
levels.description: A final project that pushes the boundaries of your knowledge and contributes to the field.

levels.title: Self-Play in Reinforcement Learning
levels.description: Techniques like those used in AlphaGo to achieve superhuman performance.

levels.title: World Models
levels.description: Training generative recurrent neural networks to model an agent's world.

levels.title: The Lottery Ticket Hypothesis
levels.description: Finding small, performant subnetworks within larger neural networks.

levels.title: AI for Formal Mathematics
levels.description: Using AI to assist in proving mathematical theorems.

levels.title: Program Synthesis
levels.description: Automatically generating programs from a high-level specification.

levels.title: Differentiable Programming
levels.description: A programming paradigm where programs can be differentiated throughout.

levels.title: Scaling Laws for Neural Models
levels.description: Understanding the relationship between model size, data size, and performance.

levels.title: LLM Agents and Tool Use
levels.description: Giving LLMs the ability to use external tools and APIs.

levels.title: Advanced RAG Techniques
levels.description: Explore sophisticated methods for retrieval-augmented generation.

levels.title: Mixture of Experts (MoE)
levels.description: A neural network architecture that uses specialized sub-networks.

levels.title: State Space Models (Mamba)
levels.description: An emerging architecture challenging the dominance of Transformers.

levels.title: AI Safety and Alignment Research
levels.description: A deep dive into the technical challenges of creating safe AGI.

levels.title: Constitutional AI
levels.description: A method for training AI systems to adhere to a set of principles.

levels.title: AI Venture Capital
levels.description: Understanding how AI startups are funded and evaluated.

levels.title: The Global AI Talent Landscape
levels.description: Analyzing the distribution of AI talent and research across the world.

levels.title: The Final Frontier
levels.description: Contemplate your role in the future of AI.
